SEARCH
Package Person

Class Person

java.lang.Object
Person.Person
Direct Known Subclasses:
Admin, Guest, Manager, TravelAgent
public class Person extends Object
The Person class represents a person in the cruise booking system.

This class provides functionality common to all types of people in the system, such as login and account creation.

Key features of the Person class include:

  • Login functionality using the login method.
  • Account creation functionality using the createGenericAccount method.

  • Method Details

    • login

      public static Optional<Person> login(String username, String password)
      Authenticates a user login based on the provided username and password.

      This method connects to the 'cruiseDatabase' using JDBC and performs the following steps:

      1. Queries the 'LOGINDATA' table to verify the provided username and password.
      2. If a matching user is found, constructs the corresponding type of person (Guest, TravelAgent, Manager, Admin).
      3. Loads reservations for Guest accounts using the getReservations method.
      4. Returns an Optional containing the authenticated person or an empty Optional if login fails.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for the login attempt.
      password - the password for the login attempt.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the authenticated person or an empty Optional if login fails.
      See Also:
      • Guest
      • TravelAgent
      • Manager
      • Admin
      • Guest.getReservations()

    • createGenericAccount

      protected boolean createGenericAccount(String accountType)
      Creates a new account with generic details based on the specified account type.

      This method connects to the 'cruiseDatabase' using JDBC and performs the following steps:

      1. Checks if an account with the provided username and password already exists in the 'LOGINDATA' table.
      2. If the account does not exist and the required fields (username, password, name, email, address) are not empty, inserts a new account entry with generic details into the 'LOGINDATA' table.
      3. Returns true if the account is successfully created, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      accountType - the type of account to be created (e.g., "GUEST", "TRAVELAGENT", "MANAGER", "ADMIN").
      Returns:
      true if the account is successfully created, false otherwise.
